sentences.en: He yearned for wearing a set of descent vesture in front of female schoolmates.
sentences.cn: 他渴望穿一身体面的衣裳站在女同学的面前。

sentences.en: His vesture was dabbled in blood.
sentences.cn: 他穿的衣服上溅满了鲜血.

sentences.en: KJV They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.
sentences.cn: [新译]他们彼此分了我的外衣, 又为我的内衣抽签.

sentences.en: Our city offer overseas in vesture fair service for production aside from infrastructure.
sentences.cn: 我市除了向外国投资者提供基础设施外,还提供良好的生产服务设施.

sentences.en: They part my garments among them , and cast lots upon my vesture.
sentences.cn: 18他们分我的外衣,为我的里衣拈阄.

sentences.en: They part my garments among them, and lots upon my vesture.
sentences.cn: 他们彼此分了我的外衣, 又为我的内衣抽签.

words.tran_cn: 既定的；穿着衣服（尤指祭服）的；（美）带背心的（指西服套装）
（作礼拜时教士的）法衣；官服；祭坛布；礼服；衣服
（财产、权利等）授予（vest的过去式和过去分词）；使穿衣服

trans.tran_cn: <文，诗>衣服，覆盖物，<律>地面生长物（树林除外）
trans.tran_en: a garment or something that seems like a garment
